analyzed: catukka nipāta  pu ci manda vagga

translated: The Birth Story of the Wise Hare
pulled out of the water onto the land;
This is what I have, brahmin,
eat this and live in the forest.”

original: “Dussa me khettapālassa,🔽rattibhattaṁ apābhataṁ;🔽Maṁsasūlā ca dve godhā,
analyzed: dussa me khetta pālassa  rattibhattam apābhata  masasūlā ca dve godhā

translated: and two meat-skewers, and a pot of curd;
This is what I have, brahmin,
eat this and live in the forest.”
This is what I have, brahmin,

original: Etaṁ bhutvā vane vasa”.🔽“Na sasassa tilā atthi,
analyzed: etam bhutvā vane vasa  na sasassa tilāḥ atthi
translated: eat this and live in the forest.”🔽“There are no sesame seeds in the hare,
